Package tictactoe.client

Class PlayerClient

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
tictactoe.client.Client
tictactoe.client.PlayerClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class PlayerClient extends Client
Class to create a player. Made to be used by a real user (human).

    • startGame

      public NetworkMessage startGame(String role, String nextPlayer, String dimension, String size, String serializedGrid)
      Function on reception of "Start Game" by the server. Construct the adequate grid and get its role. If 'X', plays its turn.
      Specified by:
      startGame in class Client
      Parameters:
      role - The role given by the server ('X' or 'O').
      nextPlayer - The next player
      dimension - The dimension of the grid (2D or 3D).
      size - The size of the grid (its width).
      serializedGrid - The grid which is serialized.
      Returns:
      the message to answer to the server.

    • play

      public NetworkMessage play(String posOpponent)
      Function on reception of "Play" by the server. If posOpponent is set, add the opponent choice to the display-only grid. Then, waits for user to choose its position. Finally, sends this position back to the server.
      Specified by:
      play in class Client
      Parameters:
      posOpponent - The opponent choice (its last turn).
      Returns:
      The new turn of this user.

    • confirmation

      public NetworkMessage confirmation()
      Function which asks at a first time if the player confirm that he want to place his pawn in this place
      Specified by:
      confirmation in class Client
      Returns:
      a protocol action if the player answer "Oui" to the question

    • validate

      public NetworkMessage validate(String position)
      Function which ensure at a second time if the player can place his pawn
      Specified by:
      validate in class Client
      Parameters:
      position - Position of the pawn placed
      Returns:
      a protocol action which indicate to the player that he must wait to his next turn

    • endGame

      public NetworkMessage endGame(String position, char role, char isDraw)
      Function which manage the end of the game: display the final grid and the win combinaison in case of victory
      Specified by:
      endGame in class Client
      Parameters:
      position - Position of the pawn placed
      role - Role indicate which player plays currently
      isDraw - IsDraw is a variable indicating the case of an equality at the end
      Returns:
      a protocol action to the both player

    • opponentDisconnected

      public NetworkMessage opponentDisconnected()
